definitions.definition: To play on a flute.
To make a flutelike sound.
To utter with a flutelike sound.
To form flutes or channels in (as in a column, a ruffle, etc.); to cut a semicylindrical vertical groove in (as in a pillar, etc.).
Having flutes or grooves, either for decoration or to trim weight.
Drunk; intoxicated.
An agreement or contract.
A small, slim folding case, often featuring a mirror, powder and a powderpuff; that fits into a woman's purse or handbag, or that slips into one's pocket.
A broadsheet newspaper published in the size of a tabloid but keeping its non-sensational style.
To make more dense; to compress.
To unite or connect firmly, as in a system.
The self, especially with a sense of self-importance.
(Freudian) The most central part of the mind, which mediates with one's surroundings.
Inflammation of the mucous membranes of the nose.
To make sweet to the taste.

definitions.definition: To make (more) pleasant or to the mind or feelings.
definitions.example: to sweeten friendship

definitions.definition: To make mild or kind; to soften.
definitions.example: to sweeten the temper

definitions.definition: To make less painful or laborious; to relieve.
definitions.example: to sweeten the cares of life

definitions.definition: To soften to the eye; to make delicate.
To make pure and salubrious by destroying noxious matter.
definitions.example: to sweeten rooms or apartments that have been infected

definitions.definition: To make warm and fertile.
definitions.example: to dry and sweeten soils

definitions.definition: To restore to purity; to free from taint.

definitions.definition: To make more attractive; said of offers in negotiations.
To become sweet.
Made to taste sweet
Containing sweetener
Made more appealing or more attractive with incentives
The act of prying.
An excessively inquisitive person.
A lever.
Leverage.
To look where one is not welcome; to be nosy.
To keep asking about something that does not concern one.
To look closely and curiously at (something closed or not public).
To use leverage to open or widen.
The meat of a deer.
definitions.example: After shooting a deer, field dressing is the next step necessary for high quality venison.

definitions.definition: The meat of an antelope.
definitions.example: 2007, Gregory Simon Bull, Marketing fresh venison in the Eastern Cape Province using a niche marketing strategy (thesis), page xcix

definitions.definition: The meat of any wild animal that has been hunted rather than raised domestically.
A microcomputer on a single chip, used to control some device such as an automobile engine or a toy.
A sandbank or sandbar creating a shallow.
A shallow in a body of water.
Any large number of persons or things.
(collective) A large number of fish (or other sea creatures) of the same species swimming together.
To arrive at a shallow (or less deep) area.
To cause a shallowing; to come to a more shallow part of.
To become shallow.
definitions.example: The colour of the water shows where it shoals.

definitions.definition: To collect in a shoal; to throng.
definitions.example: The fish shoaled about the place.

definitions.definition: Shallow.
definitions.example: shoal water

definitions.definition: To fill beyond reasonable limits, with people, animals, objects or information.
The situation where a space holds more occupants than it can comfortably accommodate.
To bathe in warmth; to be exposed to pleasant heat.
definitions.example: to bask in the sun

definitions.definition: To take great pleasure or satisfaction; to feel warmth or happiness. (This verb is usually followed by "in").
definitions.example: I basked in her love.

definitions.definition: The act of one who basks.
An act or instance of retracting.
A statement printed or broadcast in a public forum which effects the withdrawal of an earlier assertion, and which concedes that the earlier assertion was in error.
A continuous function from a topological space onto a subspace which is the identity on that subspace.
To make a high-pitched, short and somewhat sharp sound.
definitions.example: My car was pinging until my last oil change.

definitions.definition: (submarine navigation) To emit a signal and then listen for its echo in order to detect objects.
To send a packet in order to determine whether a host is present, particularly by use of the ping utility.
definitions.example: I'm pinging their server.

definitions.definition: (by extension) To send an email or other message to someone in hopes of eliciting a response.
definitions.example: I'll ping the insurance company again to see if they've received our claim.

definitions.definition: To flick.
definitions.example: I pinged the crumb off the table with my finger.

definitions.definition: To bounce.
definitions.example: The ball pinged off the wall and came hurtling back.

definitions.definition: To cause something to bounce.
To call out audibly.
To penalize.
definitions.example: Gary Ablett was pinged for holding the ball and gave away a free kick.

definitions.definition: The sound of a ping.
The act of sending a ping, as by a submarine or over a computer network.
The procedure of introducing a catheter.
definitions.example: Since the development of fiber optics, treatments utilizing catheterization have replaced some former surgical procedures.

definitions.definition: To spread (a substance, especially one that colours or is dirty) across a surface by rubbing.
definitions.example: The artist smeared paint over the canvas in broad strokes.

definitions.definition: To have a substance smeared on (a surface).
definitions.example: She smeared her lips with lipstick.

definitions.definition: To damage someone's reputation by slandering, misrepresenting, or otherwise making false accusations about an individual, their statements, or their actions.
definitions.example: The opposition party attempted to smear the candidate by spreading incorrect and unverifiable rumors about their personal behavior.

definitions.definition: To become spread by smearing.
definitions.example: The paint is still wet — don't touch it or it will smear.

definitions.definition: To climb without using footholds, using the friction from the shoe to stay on the wall.
To remove the outer covering or skin of something with a cutting device, typically a knife
definitions.example: Victor pared some apples in preparation to make a tart.

definitions.definition: (often with down or back) to reduce, diminish or trim gradually something as if by cutting off
definitions.example: Albert had to pare his options down by disregarding anything beyond his meager budget.

definitions.definition: To trim the hoof of a horse
To become red in the face (and sometimes experience an associated feeling of warmth), especially due to shyness, shame, excitement, or embarrassment.
definitions.example: He wasn't used to this much attention, so he blushed as he saw dozens of pairs of eyes watching him.

definitions.definition: To be ashamed or embarrassed (to do something).
To become red.
To suffuse with a blush; to redden; to make rosy.
To change skin color in the face (to a particular shade).
definitions.example: I wasn't surprised, but it was embarrassing enough that I blushed a little pink.

definitions.definition: To express or make known by blushing.
definitions.example: Looking at me with a knowing glare, she blushed her discomfort with the situation.

definitions.definition: To have a warm and delicate colour, like some roses and other flowers.
definitions.example: The garden was full of blossoms that blushed in myriad shades to form a beautiful carpet of color.

definitions.definition: To glance with the eye, cast a glance.
The act of one who blushes; a blush.
Showing blushes; rosy red.
definitions.example: the blushing bride

definitions.definition: To draw air into (inhale), and expel air from (exhale), the lungs in order to extract oxygen and excrete waste gases.
To take in needed gases and expel waste gases in a similar way.
definitions.example: Fish have gills so they can breathe underwater.

definitions.definition: To inhale (a gas) to sustain life.
definitions.example: While life as we know it depends on oxygen, scientists have speculated that alien life forms might breathe chlorine or methane.

definitions.definition: To live.
definitions.example: I will not allow it, as long as I still breathe.

definitions.definition: To draw something into the lungs.
definitions.example: Try not to breathe too much smoke.

definitions.definition: To expel air from the lungs, exhale.
definitions.example: If you breathe on a mirror, it will fog up.

definitions.definition: To exhale or expel (something) in the manner of breath.
definitions.example: The flowers breathed a heady perfume.

definitions.definition: To give an impression of, to exude.
definitions.example: The decor positively breathes classical elegance.

definitions.definition: To whisper quietly.
definitions.example: He breathed the words into her ear, but she understood them all.

definitions.definition: To pass like breath; noiselessly or gently; to emanate; to blow gently.
definitions.example: The wind breathes through the trees.

definitions.definition: To exchange gases with the environment.
definitions.example: Garments made of certain new materials breathe well and keep the skin relatively dry during exercise.

definitions.definition: To rest; to stop and catch one's breath.
To stop, to give (a horse) an opportunity to catch its breath.
definitions.example: At higher altitudes you need to breathe your horse more often.

definitions.definition: To exercise; to tire by brisk exercise.
To passionately devote much of one's life to (an activity, etc.).
definitions.example: Do you like hiking?  Are you kidding? I breathe hiking.

definitions.definition: An officer of the Queen's Body Guard of the Yeomen of the Guard.
A region of a transcribed gene present in the final functional RNA molecule.
A traditional form of Mexican music, either sung or purely instrumental.
A group that plays mariachi music.
A member of such a group.
Of or pertaining to a traditional form of Mexican music, either sung or purely instrumental.
Of or pertaining to a band playing such music, or to the singers of such songs.
The anniversary of the day on which someone is born.
The anniversary of the day on which something is created.
The date on which someone is born or something is created, more commonly called birthdate or date of birth.
To teach (somebody) by giving a speech on a given topic.
definitions.example: The professor lectured to two classes this morning.

definitions.definition: To preach, to berate, to scold.
definitions.example: Emily's father lectured her about the importance of being home before midnight.

definitions.definition: To seal (something) again (in any sense of "apply a seal to").
To make a composite.

definitions.definition: Construction of a composite image by combining multiple images and/or other elements.

A drink of half stout and half porter.
A floating grog shop supplying the North Sea fishing industry.
To make and repair barrels etc.
A cumulative package of one or more files used to address a problem in a software product.
The living organisms of a region.
Platycladus orientalis (syn. Biota orientalis, Oriental arborvitae).
A collection of papers and/or other sources, containing detailed information about a particular person or subject, together with a synopsis of their content.

A nerve fibre which is a long slender projection of a nerve cell, and which conducts nerve impulses away from the body of the cell to a synapse.
A computer.
An act or instance of deflating.

definitions.definition: A decrease in the general price level, that is, in the nominal cost of goods and services as well as wages.
An economic contraction.
To make worse; to impair.

definitions.definition: To become worse; to get worse.

definitions.definition: To get the better of; to worst.
To construct something anew, or in a different manner
To add liquid to a concentrated or dehydrated food to return it to its original consistency
Constructed anew
In a skillful manner; with skill.
Intoxicating or stupefying.

definitions.definition: Tending to upset the mind or senses.

definitions.definition: Exhilarating.

definitions.definition: Intellectual.

definitions.definition: Rash or impetuous.

definitions.definition: To bowl a yorker at a batsman, especially to get a batsman out in this way.
To vomit.
To continuously attack something with bombs, artillery shells or other missiles or projectiles.
To attack something or someone by directing objects at them.
To direct at a substance an intense stream of high-energy particles, usually sub-atomic or made of at most a few atoms.

To prepare and arrange (usually military unit or units) for use.

definitions.definition: To unfold, open, or otherwise become ready for use.

definitions.definition: To install, test and implement a computer system or application.

definitions.definition: A prehistoric chisel-bladed tool.
A politician.
A swimming stroke swum lying on one's back, while rotating both arms through the water as to propel the swimmer backwards.

To swim the backstroke.
To clean oneself by immersion in water or using water; to take a bath, have a bath.

definitions.definition: To apply water or other liquid to; to suffuse or cover with liquid.

definitions.definition: (transitive and intransitive) To cover or surround.

Marked with dots or spots, spotted.

To determine the amount of.

definitions.definition: To convince of by argument, or by reasons offered or suggested from reflection, etc.; to cause to believe (something).

An 8-inch floppy disk.

definitions.definition: To have an effect or impact; to influence; to engender support.

definitions.definition: To give (especially public) notice of (something); to announce publicly.
To provide information about a person or goods and services to influence others.

definitions.definition: To provide public information about (a product, service etc.) in order to attract public awareness and increase sales.

A pair of fives.

The region of the field between the infield and the outer fence.

In an incremental fashion; by small additions.

A hoarding (temporary structure used during construction).
A hoarding (billboard).
To amass, usually for one's own private collection.
To seek to achieve or win.

definitions.definition: To risk (a consequence, usually negative).

definitions.definition: To try to win a commitment to marry from.
To engage in behavior leading to mating.

definitions.definition: To attempt to attract.
To attempt to gain alliance with.
To engage in activities intended to win someone's affections.
definitions.example: She's had a few beaus come courting.

definitions.definition: To engage in courtship behavior.
definitions.example: In this season, you can see many animals courting.

definitions.definition: To invite by attractions; to allure; to attract.

Any of several small turtles, of the families Emydidae and Geoemydidae, that live in fresh or brackish water.
The process of making something legal, the process to legalize, decriminalization.
definitions.example: The hippies marched for the legalization of marijuana.

To weigh down, oppress, or burden.
To use a ladle or dipper to remove something (generally water).

The action of loading.

To become modern in appearance, or adopt modern ways

A simpleton.
The act of starting something again.

To agitate rapidly and repetitively, or to stir with a rowing or rocking motion; generally applies to liquids, notably cream.
definitions.example: Now the cream is churned to make butter.

definitions.definition: To produce excessive and sometimes undesirable or unproductive activity or motion.
To move rapidly and repetitively with a rocking motion; to tumble, mix or shake.
definitions.example: I was so nervous that my stomach was churning.

definitions.definition: (of a customer) To stop using a company's product or service.
(travel) To repeatedly cancel and rebook a reservation in order to refresh ticket time limits or other fare rule restrictions.
(travel) To continually sign up for new credit cards in order to earn signup bonuses, airline miles, and other benefits.
The act by which something is churned.
The quantity of butter prepared (by churning) at one time.
A two-wheeled horse-drawn vehicle, used in Bronze Age and Early Iron Age warfare.
A light four-wheeled carriage used for ceremonial or pleasure purposes.
(xiangqi) rook
A long, narrow flag, or piece of material used or seen as a decoration.
Strips of paper or other material used as confetti.
A newspaper headline that runs along the top of a page.
(heading) In computing.
In fly fishing, a variety of wet fly designed to mimic a minnow.
One who searches for stream tin.
A stream or column of light shooting upward from the horizon, constituting one of the forms of the aurora borealis.
One who, or that which, accumulates.

definitions.definition: A wet-cell storage battery.
definitions.example: Looks like it's time to recharge the accumulator again.

definitions.definition: (betting) A collective bet on successive events, with both stake and winnings being carried forward to accumulate progressively.
A system of elastic springs for relieving the strain upon a rope, as in deep-sea dredging.
A vessel containing pressurized hot water ready for release as steam.

A register or variable used for holding the intermediate results of a computation or data transfer.
A derivative contract under which the seller commits to sell shares of an underlying security at a certain strike price, which the buyer is obligated to buy.
One who takes two higher degrees simultaneously, to reduce their length of study.
A one way membership function.
An army unit having two or more companies, etc. and a headquarters. Traditionally forming part of a regiment.
An army unit having two or more companies, etc. and a headquarters; forming part of a brigade.
Any large body of troops.
(by extension) A great number of things.
Without question; beyond doubt; indubitably.
OK, right-on
A perennial flowering plant (of the genus Crocus in the Iridaceae family). Saffron is obtained from the stamens of Crocus sativus.
Any of various similar flowering plants, such as the autumn crocus and prairie crocus.
A deep yellow powder, the oxide of some metal (especially iron), calcined to a red or deep yellow colour.
A fraudulent doctor; a quack.
Burlap.

Disgrace or shame.

Not related to the matter under discussion.

Of or relating to the jaw and face.

The dried leaves or pods of these plants (especially of Senna alexandrina, syn. Cassia angustifolia or Cassia acutifolia), used medicinally.
Senna glycoside, a laxative.
To become aware of, through the physical senses or by thinking; to see; to understand.
The act by which something is perceived.
A room for keeping clothes and armor safe, particularly a dressing room or walk-in closet beside a bedroom.
A governmental office or department in a monarchy which purchases, keeps, and cares for royal clothes.
The building housing such a department.
Any closet used for storing anything.
A room for keeping costumes and other property safe at a theater; a prop room.
The department of a theater, movie studio, etc which purchases, keeps, and cares for costumes; its staff; its room(s) or building(s).
A movable cupboard or cabinet designed for storing clothes, particularly as a large piece of bedroom furniture.
A tall built-in cupboard or closet for storing clothes, often including a rail for coat-hangers, and usually located in a bedroom.
Anything that similarly stores or houses something.
The contents of a wardrobe: an individual's entire collection of clothing.
Any collection of clothing.
Any collection of anything.
A private chamber, particularly one used for sleeping or urinating and defecating.
Badger feces, particularly used in tracking game.
To act as a wardrobe department, to provide clothing or sets of clothes.
The act of commending; praise; favorable representation in words; recommendation.
That which is the ground of approbation or praise.
A message of affection or respect; compliments; greeting.
An award or recognition for performance; a medal.
Relating to surgery; by means of surgery.
definitions.example: His cancer was treated surgically instead of with drugs or radiation.

definitions.definition: Not governmental; not derived from a government; civilian.
A thick paste made by fermentation of soybeans with the mold Aspergillus oryzae, used in making soups and sauces.
Of or relating to hydrostatics.
Of or relating to fluids, especially to the pressure that they exert or transmit.
One who cheats.
An improvised breaker bar made from a length of pipe and a wrench (spanner), usually used to free screws, bolts, etc. that are difficult to remove with a ratchet or wrench alone.
An escheater.
Non-prescription spectacles that magnify.
To strive in opposition; to contest; to dispute; to vie; to quarrel; to fight.
To struggle or exert oneself to obtain or retain possession of, or to defend.
To strive in debate; to engage in discussion; to dispute; to argue.
To believe (something is reasonable) and argue (for it); to advocate.
definitions.example: In this paper the author contends that no useful results can be obtained if this method is used.

definitions.definition: Contention
Characteristic of a patriarch; venerable.
Relating to a system run by males, rather than females.
To read (something) as though letter by letter; to peruse slowly or with effort.
(sometimes with “out”) To write or say the letters that form a word or part of a word.
To be able to write or say the letters that form words.
definitions.example: I find it difficult to spell because I'm dyslexic.

definitions.definition: Of letters: to compose (a word).
definitions.example: The letters “a”, “n” and “d” spell “and”.

definitions.definition: (with “out”) To clarify; to explain in detail.
definitions.example: Please spell it out for me.

definitions.definition: To indicate that (some event) will occur.
definitions.example: This spells trouble.

definitions.definition: To constitute; to measure.
To speak, to declaim.
To tell; to relate; to teach.
To work in place of (someone).
definitions.example: to spell the helmsman

definitions.definition: To rest (someone or something), to give someone or something a rest or break.
definitions.example: They spelled the horses and rested in the shade of some trees near a brook.

definitions.definition: To rest from work for a time.
To split; to break; to spalt.
A grain, considered either a subspecies of wheat, Triticum aestivum subsp. spelta, or a separate species Triticum spelta or Triticum dicoccon.
A thin piece of wood or metal; a splinter.
Spelter.
The short, loud, explosive sound uttered by a dog, a fox, and some other animals.
An abrupt loud vocal utterance.
The exterior covering of the trunk and branches of a tree.
Peruvian bark or Jesuit's bark, the bark of the cinchona from which quinine is produced.
Hard candy made in flat sheets, for instance out of chocolate, peanut butter, toffee or peppermint.
The crust formed on barbecued meat that has had a rub applied to it.
The envelopment or outer covering of anything.
A small sailing vessel, e.g. a pinnace or a fishing smack; a rowing boat or barge.
A sailing vessel or boat of any kind.
A vessel, typically with three (or more) masts, with the foremasts (or fore- and mainmasts) square-rigged, and mizzenmast schooner-rigged.
To make a short, loud, explosive noise with the vocal organs (said of animals, especially dogs).
definitions.example: The neighbour's dog is always barking.

definitions.definition: To make a clamor; to make importunate outcries.
To speak sharply.
definitions.example: The sergeant barked an order.

definitions.definition: To strip the bark from; to peel.
To abrade or rub off any outer covering from.
definitions.example: to bark one’s heel

definitions.definition: To girdle.
To cover or inclose with bark, or as with bark.
definitions.example: bark the roof of a hut

definitions.definition: Any of several mostly anaerobic gram-positive bacteria, of the genus Clostridium, that are present in the soil and in the intestines of humans and animals and are capable of forming spores
(of a person) Being or like a nerd.
definitions.example: That guy is nerdy and weird.

definitions.definition: (of a quality or interest) Of, pertaining to, in the style of, or appealing to nerds.
definitions.example: I got a pair of nerdy glasses and clothes for Halloween.

definitions.definition: A large supermarket or similar retail outlet; a superstore.
To avoid (something) by moving suddenly out of the way.
definitions.example: He dodged traffic crossing the street.

definitions.definition: To avoid; to sidestep.
definitions.example: The politician dodged the question with a meaningless reply.

definitions.definition: To go hither and thither.
(videography) To decrease the exposure for certain areas of an image in order to make them darker (compare burn).
To follow by dodging, or suddenly shifting from place to place.
To trick somebody.
The act of dodging; a dodge.
definitions.example: twistings and dodgings

definitions.definition: (grammar) The grammatical mood expressing an order (see jussive). In English, the imperative form of a verb is the same as that of the bare infinitive.
definitions.example: The verbs in sentences like "Do it!" and "Say what you like!" are in the imperative.

definitions.definition: (grammar) A verb in imperative mood.
An essential action, a must: something which is imperative.
definitions.example: Visiting Berlin is an imperative.

definitions.definition: An original model of which all other similar concepts, objects, or persons are merely copied, derivative, emulated, or patterned; a prototype.
An ideal example of something; a quintessence.
A character, object, or story that is based on a known character, object, or story.
According to Swiss psychologist Carl Jung: a universal pattern of thought, present in an individual's unconscious, inherited from the past collective experience of humanity.
(textual criticism) A protograph.
To depict as, model using, or otherwise associate an object or subject with an archetype.

Any substance that inhibits the growth and reproduction of microorganisms. Generally includes only those that are used on living objects (as opposed to disinfectants) and aren't transported by the lymphatic system to destroy bacteria in the body (as opposed to antibiotics).
Of, or relating to antisepsis, or the use of antiseptics.
(pharmaceutical effect) Capable of preventing microbial infection.
Very clean; aseptic.
Free of unpleasantness; prim, sanitized or bowdlerized.
To become brown.
definitions.example: Fry the onions until they brown.

definitions.definition: To cook something until it becomes brown.
definitions.example: Brown the onions in a large frying pan.

definitions.definition: To tan.
definitions.example: Light-skinned people tend to brown when exposed to the sun.

definitions.definition: To make brown or dusky.
To give a bright brown colour to, as to gun barrels, by forming a thin coating of oxide on their surface.
(usually derogatory) To turn progressively more Middle Eastern, Hispanic or Latino, in the context of the population of a geographic region.
definitions.example: the browning of America

definitions.definition: To treat with deference, or respect.
An articulated lorry.
An articulated bus.
A band of strong tissue that connects bones to other bones.
That which binds or acts as a ligament.
A fuel metering/delivery pump at a filling station.
A road vehicle (often a trailer) for the transport of liquid fuel, particularly aviation fuel at an airfield.
A mobile water tank deployed to distribute fresh water in emergency situations where the normal system of piped distribution has broken down or is insufficient.
(used in the vocative) A buffoon or imbecile.
An emission of a rapid stream of bubbles.
definitions.example: I poured a cola and waited for the fizz to settle down before topping off the glass.

definitions.definition: The sound of such an emission.
definitions.example: Evan sat back in the hot tub and listened to the relaxing fizz and pops produced by the eruption of bubbles.

definitions.definition: A carbonated beverage, especially champagne.
definitions.example: Nathan ordered an orange fizz from the soda jerk at the counter.

definitions.definition: To emit bubbles.
To make a rapid hissing or bubbling sound.
definitions.example: the fizzing fuse of a bomb

definitions.definition: To shoot or project something moving at great velocity.
To travel at a great velocity, producing a sound caused by the speed.
Change, from one state to another
The process of being heaved upward, especially the raising of part of the earth's crust.
A sudden violent upset, disruption or convulsion.
To make something rational or more rational.

To justify an immoral act, or illogical behaviour. “The process of thought by which one justifies a discreditable act, and by which one offers to oneself and the world a better motive for one's action than the true motive”
To remove radicals, without changing the value of an expression or the roots of an equation.
To structure something along modern, efficient and systematic lines, or according to scientific principles. This often includes eliminating duplication and grouping like or similar items.
A posture or gesture of shrinking or recoiling.
definitions.example: He glanced with a cringe at the mess on his desk.

definitions.definition: A servile obeisance.
A crick.
An embarrassing event or situation which causes an onlooker to cringe.
definitions.example: There was so much cringe in that episode!

definitions.definition: Someone or something that is cringy.
definitions.example: That video was full of cringe.

definitions.definition: To shrink, cower, tense or recoil, as in fear, disgust or embarrassment.
definitions.example: He cringed as the bird collided with the window.

definitions.definition: To bow or crouch in servility.
To contract; to draw together; to cause to shrink or wrinkle; to distort.
To drive or draw from the earth.
definitions.example: to unearth a fox or a badger

definitions.definition: To uncover or find; to bring out from concealment
definitions.example: to unearth a secret

definitions.definition: To dig up.
The removal and examination of a sample of tissue, cells, or bodily fluid from a living body for diagnostic purposes.
definitions.example: We will need to perform a biopsy to determine whether the tumour is malignant or benign.

definitions.definition: To take a sample (a biopsy) for pathological examination.
definitions.example: They biopsied the lump but it turned out to be non-cancerous.

definitions.definition: Not conclusive, not leading to a conclusion.
(sometimes attributive) A connection.
definitions.example: I need to buy some hookup wire.

definitions.definition: A brief sexual relationship or encounter.
definitions.example: He met his two most recent partners at bars, and expressed strong ambivalence and dislike of meeting partners online, but reported half a dozen additional hookups with partners met online.

definitions.definition: A sexual partner.
definitions.example: The predominant way of finding a hookup or sexual partner would be going online.

definitions.definition: A device that automatically responds to changes in temperature by activating a heating or cooling system to maintain the temperature at a desired setting.
A tropical grass of the genus Saccharum (especially the species Saccharum officinarum) having stout, fibrous, jointed stalks, the sap of which is a source of sugar.
An edible candy in the shape of a cane.
The amount that will fit in a mouth.
definitions.example: He swallowed a mouthful of sea water when he fell in.

definitions.definition: Quite a bit.
Something difficult to pronounce or say.
definitions.example: “She sells sea shells” is a bit of a mouthful to say.

definitions.definition: A tirade of abusive language (especially in the term “give someone a mouthful”)
Bombastic or awkward.
An antelope of either of the genera Gazella (mostly native to Africa) or Procapra (native to Asia), capable of running at high speeds for long periods.
(grammar) A subordinate clause.
A subsidiary clause in a legal contract etc.
To qualify with a subclause.
Awkward or lacking in social graces; bumbling.
Skewed, not plane.
Describing a torsion angle of 60°.
The lowest limit.
definitions.example: We need a minimum of three staff members on duty at all time.

definitions.definition: The smallest amount.
definitions.example: He always tries to get away with doing the minimum.

definitions.definition: A period of minimum brightness or energy intensity (of a star).
definitions.example: The Maunder minimum of the Sun reportedly corresponded to a period of great cold on Earth.

definitions.definition: A lower bound of a set which is also an element of that set.
The smallest member of a batch or sample or the lower bound of a probability distribution.
A loyal servant of another, usually a more powerful being.
definitions.example: The archvillain deployed his minions to simultaneously rob every bank in the city.

definitions.definition: A sycophantic follower.
A loved one; one highly esteemed and favoured.
An ancient form of ordnance with a calibre of about three inches.
The size of type between nonpareil and brevier, standardized as 7-point.
Favoured, beloved; "pet".
An expression of exasperation.
Observing or identifying wild birds in their natural environment.
An illegal saloon or tavern, especially one operated during the American Prohibition period in the 1920s.
A harpist, especially one who plays a traditional harp without pedals.
An old Irish brass coin bearing the emblem of a harp.
The state of being complicit; involvement as a partner or accomplice, especially in a crime or other wrongdoing.
Complexity.
That part of a biomolecule (such as a protein) that is the target of an immune response
To remove the string or strings from.
definitions.example: Unstring the bows before storing them.

definitions.definition: To shake the nerves of; to cause anxiety or panic in.
To defuse or relax.
To remove from a string; to release something that has been strung up or strung together.
To untie.
(COBOL) To split (a text string) into smaller strings by separating on a delimiter.
Not strung
Senseless talk; nonsense
Saliva, drool
A fool; an idiot.
A servant; a drudge.
To have saliva drip from the mouth; to drool.
To talk nonsense; to talk senselessly; to drool.
To be weak or foolish; to dote.
A tough band of inelastic fibrous tissue that connects a muscle with its bony attachment.
A wire or bar used to strengthen prestressed concrete.
A point at which reflected or refracted rays of light converge.
definitions.example: The heat of sunlight at the focus of a magnifying glass can easily set dry leaves on fire.

definitions.definition: A point of a conic at which rays reflected from a curve or surface converge.
The fact of the convergence of light on the photographic medium.
definitions.example: Unfortunately, the license plate is out of focus in this image.

definitions.definition: The quality of the convergence of light on the photographic medium.
definitions.example: During this scene, the boy’s face shifts subtly from soft focus into sharp focus.

definitions.definition: Concentration of attention.
definitions.example: I believe I can bring the high degree of focus required for this important job.

definitions.definition: The exact point of where an earthquake occurs, in three dimensions (underneath the epicentre).
definitions.example: The earthquake's focus was at exactly 37 degrees north, 18 degrees south, seventy five meters below the ground.

definitions.definition: The indicator of the currently active element in a user interface.
definitions.example: Text entered at the keyboard or pasted from a clipboard is sent to the component which currently has the focus.

definitions.definition: The most important word or phrase in a sentence or passage, or the one that imparts information.
An object used in casting a magic spell.
Any food item added on top of another, such as sprinkles on ice cream or pepperoni on pizza.
The act of cutting off the top of something.
The act of raising one extremity of a spar higher than the other.
Either of the cables that support the ends of a spar or boom.
The tail of an artificial fly.
A beam anchored at one end and projecting into space, such as a long bracket projecting from a wall to support a balcony.
A beam anchored at one end and used as a lever within a microelectromechanical system.
A technique, similar to the spread eagle, in which the skater travels along a deep edge with knees bent and bends their back backwards, parallel to the ice.
To project (something) in the manner of or by means of a cantilever.
To grow or increase stature; to grow vigorously or luxuriantly, to flourish.
definitions.example: Not all animals thrive well in captivity.

definitions.definition: To increase in wealth or success; to prosper, be profitable.
definitions.example: Since expanding in June, the business has really thrived.

definitions.definition: To assign initial values to something
To assign an initial value to a variable
To format a storage medium prior to use
To prepare any hardware (such as a printer or scanner) for use
Taste, liking, or inclination (for).
definitions.example: He has a penchant for fine wine.

definitions.definition: A card game resembling bezique.
In the game of penchant, any queen and jack of different suits held at the same time.
To retch or heave as if to vomit.
The cow parsley (Anthriscus sylvestris).
(Manx) animal dung
To make a loud, deep cry, especially from pain, anger, or other strong emotion.
To laugh in a particularly loud manner.
definitions.example: The audience roared at his jokes.

definitions.definition: Of animals (especially the lion), to make a loud deep noise.
definitions.example: The lioness roared to scare off the hyenas.

definitions.definition: Generally, of inanimate objects etc., to make a loud resounding noise.
To proceed vigorously.
To cry aloud; to proclaim loudly.
To be boisterous; to be disorderly.
To make a loud noise in breathing, as horses do when they have a certain disease.
(North Midlands) to cry
A person who explores or prospects an area in search of mineral deposits, such as gold.
Not wise; lacking wisdom
definitions.example: unwise kings

definitions.definition: A person who, as a profession, profits from large financial transactions.
A company that does the same.
One charged with the administration of finance; an officer who administers the public revenue; a treasurer.
A light, spongy teacake, usually based on almond flour or flavoring.

A traditional French (Ragoût a la Financière) or Piemontese (Finanziera alla piemontese) rich sauce or ragout, made with coxcomb, wattles, cock's testicles, chicken livers and a variety of other ingredients.
To carry out financial transactions; to finance something.
The representation of abstract principles by characters or figures.
A picture, book, or other form of communication using such representation.
A symbolic representation which can be interpreted to reveal a hidden meaning, usually a moral or political one.
A category that retains some of the structure of the category of binary relations between sets, representing a high-level generalisation of that category.
Any place of shelter.
definitions.example: The neighborhood is a well-known harbor for petty thieves.

definitions.definition: A sheltered expanse of water, adjacent to land, in which ships may anchor or dock, especially for loading and unloading.
(glassworking) A mixing box for materials.
A house of the zodiac, or the mansion of a heavenly body.
Shelter, refuge.
To provide a harbor or safe place for.
definitions.example: The docks, which once harbored tall ships, now harbor only petty thieves.

definitions.definition: To take refuge or shelter in a protected expanse of water.
definitions.example: The fleet harbored in the south.

definitions.definition: To drive (a hunted stag) to covert.
To hold or persistently entertain in one's thoughts or mind.
definitions.example: She harbors a conviction that her husband has a secret, criminal past.

definitions.definition: A promontory (usually fortified with a citadel) forming the hub of many Grecian cities, and around which many were built for defensive purposes before and during the classical period; compare Acropolis.
A hind knee of various mammals, especially horses.
A bone disease of this region.
To interrupt or cut off.
To repress, keep in or hold back.
definitions.example: The army stifled the rebellion.

definitions.definition: To smother or suffocate.
definitions.example: The heat was stifling the children.

definitions.definition: To feel smothered etc.
definitions.example: The heat felt stifling.

definitions.definition: To die of suffocation.
definitions.example: Two firemen tragically stifled in yesterday's fire when trying to rescue an old lady from her bedroom.

definitions.definition: To treat a silkworm cocoon with steam as part of the process of silk production.
Relating to, or found within the lymphatic system of the body
Having self-contradictory properties.
A small industrial vehicle with a power-operated fork-like pronged platform that can be raised and lowered for insertion under a load, often on pallets, to be lifted and moved
A state of safety, protection or shelter.
A place providing safety, protection or shelter.
Something or someone turned to for safety or assistance; a recourse or resort.
An expedient to secure protection or defence.
A refuge island.
Of a system or protocol, such that it does not keep a persistent state between transactions.
definitions.example: A stateless server treats each request independently.

definitions.definition: Without state or pomp.
Without a state or nationality, not subject to any state.
definitions.example: UN Convention relating to the Status of Stateless Persons

definitions.definition: Neither believing in nor supporting the idea of nations.
To wake (someone) or be awoken from sleep, or from apathy.
To cause, stir up, excite (a feeling, thought, etc.).
definitions.example: to rouse the faculties, passions, or emotions

definitions.definition: To provoke (someone) to action or anger.
To cause to start from a covert or lurking place.
definitions.example: to rouse a deer or other animal of the chase

definitions.definition: To pull by main strength; to haul.
To raise; to make erect.
(when followed by "on") To tell off; to criticise.
definitions.example: He roused on her for being late yet again.

definitions.definition: The act by which somebody or something is roused.
That rouses or excites.
definitions.example: rousing music

definitions.definition: Part of the hindbrain in vertebrates. In humans it lies between the brainstem and the cerebrum. It plays an important role in sensory perception, motor output, balance and posture.
The property of being a state.
definitions.example: Alaska didn't attain statehood until 1959, when it became the 49th state of the United States.

definitions.definition: The condition of being a country.
To rest on one's bent knees, sometimes only one; to move to such a position.
To cause to kneel.
definitions.example: She knelt the doll to fit it into the box.

definitions.definition: To rest on (one's) knees
definitions.example: He knelt him down to pray.

definitions.definition: To extend, send or spread out from a center like radii.
To emit rays or waves.
definitions.example: The stove radiates heat.

definitions.definition: To come out or proceed in rays or waves.
definitions.example: The heat radiates from a stove.

definitions.definition: To illuminate.
To expose to ionizing radiation, such as by radiography.
To manifest oneself in a glowing manner.
(ecology, intransitive) to spread into new habitats, migrate.
To eat quickly, greedily, hungrily, or ravenously.
To rapidly destroy, engulf, or lay waste.
definitions.example: The fire was devouring the building.

definitions.definition: To take in avidly with the intellect or with one's gaze.
definitions.example: She intended to devour the book.

definitions.definition: To absorb or engross the mind fully, especially in a destructive manner.
definitions.example: After the death of his wife, he was devoured by grief.

definitions.definition: In an insane manner; not sanely.
To a great degree; very much.
definitions.example: Disney has some insanely fun roller coasters.

definitions.definition: Deliberate, often calculated, disregard for trust or faith.
The act of violating the confidence of another, usually for personal gain.
Treason.
To stroke or fondle (an animal).
To stroke or fondle (another person) amorously.
Of two or more people, to stroke and fondle one another amorously.
To treat as a pet; to fondle; to indulge.
definitions.example: His daughter was petted and spoiled.

definitions.definition: To be a pet.
To be peevish; to sulk.
The act of stroking or gently patting an animal.
The act of kissing, stroking, etc., a person in a sexual manner.
The act of indulging or treating as a favourite.
To introduce an antigenic substance or vaccine into something (e.g. the body) or someone, such as to produce immunity to a specific disease.
(by extension) To safeguard or protect something as if by inoculation.
To add one substance to another; to spike.
definitions.example: The culture medium was inoculated with selenium to investigate the rate of uptake.

definitions.definition: To graft by inserting buds.
definitions.example: to inoculate a tree

definitions.definition: To introduce into the mind (used especially of harmful ideas or principles); to imbue; to implant.
definitions.example: to inoculate someone with treason or infidelity

definitions.definition: (usually uncountable) A sweet chewing gum formulated to be stretchy so the chewer can blow bubbles with it.
(sometimes derogatory) A type of pop music marked by sweetness, pep and charm (rather than depth or complexity).
A light pink colour, like bubblegum.
Tasting like bubblegum
By extension, sweet, perky, or youthful
A female member of a royal family other than a queen, especially a daughter or granddaughter.
A woman or girl who excels in a given field or class.
A female ruler or monarch; a queen.
The wife of a prince; the female ruler of a principality.
definitions.example: Princess Grace was the Princess of Monaco.

definitions.definition: A young girl; used as a term of endearment.
A young girl or woman (or less commonly a man) who is vain, spoiled or selfish; a prima donna.
A tinted crystal marble used in children's games.
A type of court card in the Tarot pack, coming between the 10 and the prince (Jack).
A female lemur.
The art of stuffing and mounting the skins of dead animals for exhibition in a lifelike state.
To stuff and mount the skin of a dead animal.
A portrait; a likeness; a painted resemblance; hence, that which is copied from some example or model.
The art of painting or photographing portraits.
A portrait (or portraits considered as a group).
To make someone or something incapable of doing something; to disable.

definitions.definition: To make someone ineligible; to disqualify.
Rendered unable to act; restricted from taking action.
A Cashmere; a goat native to Kashmir.
Cashmere: the fine wool that grows under the hair of this goat.
Cashmere: a soft fabric made from this wool.
To affirm to be correct, true, or genuine.

definitions.definition: To certify by signature or oath.

definitions.definition: To certify in an official capacity.
To supply or be evidence of.

definitions.definition: To put under oath.
To call to witness; to invoke.
Proven; shown to be true with evidence
Supported with testimony
Certified as good, correct, or pure
Of words or languages, proven to have existed by records.

definitions.definition: (Midwest) an exclamation of surprise; oops
definitions.example: Ope! Sorry about that.

definitions.definition: (Midwest) an exclamation of surprise; oops
definitions.example: Ope! Sorry about that.

definitions.definition: To open.
Open.
One who is versed in anthropology.
A hard gelatin made by boiling bones and hides, used in solution as an adhesive; or any sticky adhesive substance.
Anything that binds two things or people together.
Birdlime.

The underside of a sirloin of beef; the fillet.
A hairstyle that is shaved or clipped short on the sides and kept long on the top.
A blow dealt upward.
To sell (something) at a lower price, or to work for lower wages, than a competitor.
To create an overhang by cutting away material from underneath.
To undermine.
To strike a heavy blow upward.
Produced by undercutting.
Designed so as to cut from the underside.
Having the parts in relief cut under.
One who roasts food.
A kitchen utensil used for roasting.
A chicken, pig, etc. suitable for roasting.
A furnace used in making ball soda.
One who roasts or banters, especially as a comedy routine.
A hot Jupiter.
An objectionable person; somebody making a fool of themselves.
To fill beyond reasonable limits, with people, animals, objects or information.
Containing too many occupants for an area of its size.
To engage in conflict (may be followed by "with" to specify the foe).
To carry on, as a contest; to wage.
The act of engaging in war or conflict.
Engaged in war; belligerent
An increase in the size of an organ due to swelling of the individual cells.

Increase in muscle size through increased size of individual muscle cells; a result of weightlifting, and other exercise. It differs from muscle hyperplasia, which is the formation of new muscle cells.
(of a tissue or organ): To increase in size.
To stimulate feelings.
definitions.example: The new building proposals in the village are arousing unneeded discomfort.

definitions.definition: To sexually stimulate.
definitions.example: I can't keep my eyes off the dancer; she arouses me greatly.

definitions.definition: To wake from sleep or stupor.
definitions.example: 1996, Beruga (line translated by Dan Owsen), Terranigma. Nintendo of America.

definitions.definition: An unsteady motion.
definitions.example: The fat man walked down the street with a wobble.

definitions.definition: A tremulous sound.
definitions.example: There was a wobble on her high notes.

definitions.definition: A low-frequency oscillation sometimes used in dubstep
To move with an uneven or rocking motion, or unsteadily to and fro.
definitions.example: the Earth wobbles slowly on its axis;  the jelly wobbled on the plate

definitions.definition: To tremble or quaver.
definitions.example: The soprano's voice wobbled alarmingly.

definitions.definition: To vacillate in one's opinions.
definitions.example: I'm wobbling between the Liberals and the Greens.

definitions.definition: To cause to wobble.
definitions.example: The boy wobbled the girl's bike.

definitions.definition: To make a clicking noise similar to the movement of the hands in an analog clock.
To make a tick or checkmark.
To work or operate, especially mechanically.
definitions.example: He took the computer apart to see how it ticked.

definitions.definition: To strike gently; to pat.
To add a bird to a list of birds that have been seen (or heard).
To go on trust, or credit.
To give tick; to trust.
Ticked off; annoyed.
A person qualified to make or repair boilers.
A whiskey with a beer chaser.
The land immediately next to, and inland from, a coast.
The rural territory surrounding an urban area, especially a port.
A remote or undeveloped area, a backwater.
That which is unknown or unexplored about someone.
Anything vague or ill-defined, especially something that is ill understood.
A party to celebrate moving into a new home.
The act of welcoming a person/family to their newly purchased or newly rented home.
definitions.example: a housewarming gift

definitions.definition: That serves to regenerate.
Being a kind of circuit, much used in radio receivers, that allows an electronic signal to be amplified many times through a feedback loop.
To clean thoroughly; to cleanse; to rid of impurities.
To free from sin, guilt, or the burden or responsibility of misdeeds
To remove by cleansing; to wash away.
To void or evacuate (the bowels or the stomach); to defecate or vomit.
To cause someone to purge, operate on (somebody) as or with a cathartic or emetic, or in a similar manner.
To clear of a charge, suspicion, or imputation
To clarify; to clear the dregs from (liquor).
To become pure, as by clarification.
To have or produce frequent evacuations from the intestines, as by means of a cathartic.
To trim, dress or prune.
One who liquidates.
One supporting the political policy of liquidationism; a liquidationist.
Any of the workers involved in cleaning up the Chernobyl disaster
Tending to rouse aversion or to repulse
Having the capacity to repel
Cold, reserved, forbidding
Without a bag, or one's bag
One who, or that which, bleaches.
(usually in the plural) A stand of tiered planks used as seating for spectators, often outdoors.
definitions.example: There could be a rough crowd out in the bleachers.

definitions.definition: (usually in the plural, by extension) The tiered seating provided for the audience at a television filming.
Any agent acting to eliminate, reduce, mask, or control odor.
An odor-controlling substance applied to the underarm to counteract odor from perspiration.
A virus that specifically infects bacteria.
President.
The act of secluding, shutting out or keeping apart.
The state of being secluded or shut out, as from company, society, the world, etc.; solitude.
A secluded, isolated or private place.
The mature phase of the extratropical cyclone life cycle.
definitions.example: warm seclusion

definitions.definition: A path along which a researcher moves to count and record observations or collect data.
To divide something by cutting transversely
To make clear; to clarify; to shed light upon.
To foreordain or predetermine, to make inevitable.
definitions.example: The oracle's prediction fated Oedipus to kill his father; not all his striving could change what would occur.

definitions.definition: Foreordained, predetermined, established in advance by fate.
A person who performs a solo.
To cause to feel fear; to scare; to cause to feel alarm or fright.
definitions.example: Avery puts a sheet over her head, pretending to be a ghost to frighten Emily.

definitions.definition: Surgical removal of all or part of a limb, etc.
The loss of a limb, etc. through trauma
A sine wave (or combination of such waves)
Having the shape or characteristics of a sine wave.
Relating to any of several channels (the sinusoids) through which venous blood passes in various organs.
A block of user documentation.
A place where one thing crosses over another.
The means by which the crossing is made.
The result of the exchange of genetic material during meiosis.
A blend of multiple styles of music or multiple film genres, intended to appeal to a wider audience.
An automobile that is a mix of two kinds of automobiles, e.g. the Pontiac Torrent.
A pair of switches and a short, diagonal length of track which together connect two parallel tracks and allow passage between them.
A piece of fiction that borrows elements from two or more fictional universes.
An athlete or swimmer who has competed in more than one of open water swimming, pool swimming, triathlon, and endurance sports.
A crossover dribble.
A computer program that parses.
One who parses.
A person or thing that hauls another person or thing.
A person or company engaged in the haulage of goods.
A miner who hauls coal from the coalface to the bottom of the shaft.
A truck, lorry (vehicle used to transport heavy goods)
Someone who makes a haul video.
To put into a catalogue.
To make a catalogue of.
To add items (e.g. books) to an existing catalogue.
The act of arranging in, or as if in, a catalogue.
To limp; move with a limping gait.
To stand in doubt whether to proceed, or what to do; hesitate; be uncertain; linger; delay; mammer.
To be lame, faulty, or defective, as in connection with ideas, or in measure, or in versification.
To waver.
To falter.
To stop marching.
To stop either temporarily or permanently.
To bring to a stop.
To cause to discontinue.

definitions.definition: A cessation, either temporary or permanent.
definitions.example: The contract negotiations put a halt to operations.

definitions.definition: A minor railway station (usually unstaffed) in the United Kingdom.

definitions.definition: Lameness; a limp.
The vertical clearance above someone's head, as in a tunnel, doorway etc.
The vertical measurement, top to bottom, for example for clearance under a bridge.
The ability of a system to reproduce loud sounds free of distortion; dynamic headroom.
The distance between the actual performance of an algorithm and its maximum possible performance.
A publication issued fortnightly (once every two weeks).
Occurring once in a fortnight; once every two weeks
Once in a fortnight; once every two weeks
Ilex paraguariensis, a species of holly native to southern South America; or the dried leaves and twigs of this plant, used to make the caffeine-rich beverage mate.
The quality of being subtle.
An instance of being subtle, a subtle thing, especially a subtle argument or distinction.
definitions.example: The subtleties of this overture are often overlooked.

definitions.definition: An ornate medieval illusion dish or table decoration, especially when made from one thing but crafted to look like another.
definitions.example: At the king's coronation feast, several subtleties were served between main courses.

definitions.definition: The quality of being clever in surreptitious or deceitful behaviour; an act or argument that shows this quality.
A trick that creates a false appearance.
The property of having a low density or thin consistency.
The property of being able to penetrate materials easily.
Credible or believable.
That brings credit or honour; respectable.
That can be assigned; assignable.
